paragraphs.content: Chapter 14
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 14

paragraphs.content: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.

paragraphs.content: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.

paragraphs.content: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?

paragraphs.content: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.

paragraphs.content: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

paragraphs.content: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.

paragraphs.content: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.

paragraphs.content: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;

paragraphs.content: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

paragraphs.content: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
paragraphs.contentHtml: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?

paragraphs.content: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:

paragraphs.content: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

paragraphs.content: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
paragraphs.contentHtml: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!

paragraphs.content: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.

paragraphs.content: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

paragraphs.content: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.

paragraphs.content: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.

paragraphs.content: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

paragraphs.content: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

paragraphs.content: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.

paragraphs.content: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
